29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

554722.name: Daythunder Anamnesis
554722.lore:
When the child of humanity drank of the crystal core, they lost the gift to sense human hearts. From then onward, their only purpose was to watch over the earth, bound to endless cycles of stars and moons.
They continued to cherish life, yet could no longer perceive neighbors as living beings.

"Prostrate upon the earth, longing for the touch of blue skies. Yet, once soaring high, the humble fragrance of grass is beyond all price..."
comeFrom: Echo of War: "Fortress of Dome" Eye of Twilight

589819.name: Celestial Section
589819.desc: Melodious section fallen from the heavens. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
589819.lore:
A musical section scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the heavens, it blends into the cacophony, like grains of sand scattered in the desert.

"No one notices it until it ignites a spark of inspiration..."

673760.name: Heavenly Melody
673760.desc: Symphonic movements from the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
673760.lore:
A piece of music scattered from order. It quietly echoes from beyond the heavens, drowned out by profound silence, like a lone star twinkling in a river of stars.

"No one feels it until it is forgotten by all ♬..."

874346.name: Firmament Note
874346.desc: Scattered note from the firmament. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
874346.lore:
A musical note scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the clouds, it blends into the symphony of mortal sounds, like a tear dissolving into the sea.

"No one hears it until it dissolves into a song..."

3276614.name: Echoing Wail
3276614.desc: A fractured carapace from black tide creatures. Normal material used for enhancement.
3276614.lore:
Grotesque heads roar, ragged blades keen enough to sunder all, while the genesis of the scourge still lurks, veiled in the shadows and shrouded by the mists of death.

"Why do you lament alone at the gravestone?"
comeFrom: Black Tide Creatures at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

3517880.name: Ethereal Omen
3517880.desc: A fragment dropped by black tide creatures. Crude material used for enhancement.
3517880.lore:
Misfortune often creeps in quietly, and by the time you perceive it, it has already swelled into a calamity that engulfs the world.

"The death knell sounds at destiny's cessation."

3526997.name: Eternal Lament
3526997.desc: A crystal born from the demise of black tide creatures. Advanced material used for enhancement.
3526997.lore:
Born of the void and destined to return to the void. A contorted existence wrought by decay, fated to wander the desolate earth purposelessly.

"Its life is one of ruin and sorrow."
comeFrom: Black Tide Creature at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

30115693.name: Charred Bud of Twilight
30115693.desc: A corrosive core found within the head of a Dark Sun Gryphon. Can be used for the Ascension of Wind characters.
30115693.lore:
The crown symbolizing celestial radiance collapses into a bud-shaped corrosive core. Beings of light succumb to shadow, while the Gryphon's searing hatred consumes itself like embers' fire.

"Light nurtures growth; darkness extorts death."
comeFrom: Stagnant Shadow: "Fortress of Dome" Eye of Twilight

ranks.name: Seize the Crowns of All
ranks.descHash: The character with "Military Merit" ignores <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the targets' DEF when dealing DMG. If "Military Merit" has been upgraded to "Peerage," then the character additionally ignores <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> of the targets' DEF when dealing Skill DMG. When Cerydra uses her Skill, regenerates <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> Energy for the designated ally target.

ranks.name: Forge the Dreams of Many
ranks.descHash: The character with "Military Merit" deals <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> increased DMG. While a teammate on the field has "Military Merit," Cerydra's DMG dealt increases by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>.

ranks.name: Torch the Laws of Old
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Help and Hurt Repaid in Full
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: A Journey Set Starward
ranks.descHash: The character with "Military Merit" increases their All-Type <u>RES PEN</u> by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>, and the multiplier for the <u>Additional DMG</u> triggered via "Military Merit" increases by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>. While a teammate on the field has "Military Merit," Cerydra's All-Type <u>RES PEN</u> increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

skills.descHash: Deals Wind DMG equal to #1[i]% of Cerydra's ATK to one designated enemy.
skills.name: King's Castling

skills.descHash: Grants "Military Merit" to one designated ally character and gives Cerydra #2[i] points of Charge. Charge is capped at #3[i] points. When Charge reaches #4[i] points, automatically upgrades the character's "Military Merit" to "Peerage" and dispels their Crowd Control debuffs. The character with "Peerage" is considered to have "Military Merit" simultaneously. The character with "Peerage" increases the CRIT DMG for their dealt Skill DMG by #1[i]%, increases their All-Type RES PEN by #5[f1]%, and triggers Coup de Main when using their Skill on enemy targets. After Coup de Main ends, consumes #4[i] points of Charge to revert "Peerage" to "Military Merit."
skills.name: Pawn's Promotion

skills.descHash: Gains #2[i] Charge. Deals Wind DMG equal to #1[i]% of Cerydra's ATK to all enemies. If no character on the field has "Military Merit," prioritizes granting "Military Merit" to the first character in the current team.
skills.name: Scholar's Mate

skills.descHash: The character with "Military Merit" increases ATK by an amount equal to #2[f1]% of Cerydra's ATK. When the character uses Basic ATK or Skill, Cerydra gains #1[i] Charge. During Coup de Main, Cerydra cannot gain Charge. After the character with "Military Merit" uses an attack, Cerydra additionally deals 1 instance of Wind Additional DMG equal to #3[i]% of her ATK. This effect can trigger up to #4[i] time(s). The trigger count resets every time Cerydra uses her Ultimate. "Military Merit" only takes effect on the most recent target. When the target changes, Cerydra's Charge is reset to 0.
skills.name: Ave Imperator

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: After using Technique, gains "Military Merit." When switching the active character, "Military Merit" transfers to the current active character. At the start of the next battle, automatically uses Skill 1 time on the character with "Military Merit" without consuming any Skill Points.
skills.name: First-Move Advantage

embedBonusSkill.descHash: For every <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> of Cerydra's ATK that exceeds <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>, increases her CRIT DMG by <nobr>#3[i]%</nobr>, up to a max increase of <nobr>#4[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Veni

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Increases Cerydra's CRIT Rate by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>. While Cerydra's Charge is below its maximum, the character with "Military Merit" using their Ultimate grants Cerydra <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> Charge. This effect can trigger once per battle.
embedBonusSkill.name: Vidi

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When using Skill, increases SPD by <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> for this unit and the teammate with "Military Merit," lasting for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s). When the character with "Military Merit" uses Basic ATK or Skill, regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy for Cerydra.
embedBonusSkill.name: Vici

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: "Flamebearer," "Tyrant," "Empress," "Supreme Commander," "Imperator"... The world has given me countless titles, but you may simply call me by my true name, Cerydra.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: No need for formalities. It's a beautiful day. Care for a game of chess?

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Do not dwell in the sorrow of parting. If you still desire to see your wish fulfilled, then surely we will stand together once more.

voiceItems.title: About Self: The Way of the Monarch
voiceItems.text: On the board, there is only black and white, only foe and friend, but the universe is so much vaster than two simple shades. The end of Amphoreus is nothing more than the first step into the cosmos, and I will march toward those far-off lights.

voiceItems.title: About Self: The Curse
voiceItems.text: Those who seek the power of Law are destined to pay an equal price... But so what? To trade burning pain for a crown, to rob divine authority in exchange for eternal infancy... Such a bargain is nothing if not perfectly fair!

voiceItems.title: Chat: Equestrianship
voiceItems.text: The thunder of a thousand hooves and the wild joy of slaying great beasts are fine pleasures... but riding a dromas, slow and steady, with the world spread beneath my feet. That is more to my liking.

voiceItems.title: Chat: The Names of the Dukes
voiceItems.text: The titles of my loyal subjects are all names I personally devised and conferred. They must carry both dignity and elegance, yet roll easily off the tongue, something that becomes a tale spoken fondly by all. What sort of title would you prefer? Dux Cinereus sounds too plain, and Dux Salvationis far too blunt...

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: Chess may sharpen one's mind for strategy, but in the midst of a feast, it's rather too serious. What if we transformed it into a cheerful game, where pieces take flight and the roll of dice guides their movement? Delightful! We'll call it Aero-Chess.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: No matter the occasion, the height of my throne's base must never change. But I must admit... those great heavy tomes, chosen for just the right thickness, are terribly cumbersome to carry.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: The scales of justice are forever balanced, yet why has the world never been fair? The strength between a human and Titan is worlds apart, and so too is Amphoreus and the vast cosmos... True Law can only be tempered through war and fire.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: Chess is the art of sacrifice and of relentless advance. The Flame-Chase army does not look back. When victory is claimed, others will offer honey brew to remember our fallen spirits.

voiceItems.title: About Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Your moves on the board are always unexpected. Two parts whimsy, three parts imagination... and five parts unwavering courage.

voiceItems.title: About Cyrene
voiceItems.text: I admire the way she speaks: not with sycophancy, nor with jest... In truth, it feels more like what you would call... friendship?
voiceItems.unlockRequirement: Unlocked after completing the Trailblaze Mission "Captives, Behold the Expanse Beyond Light"

voiceItems.title: About Hysilens
voiceItems.text: She came swimming, drawn by light and warmth, in pursuit of the ocean's Law. We seldom spoke at length. A single chessboard, a simple melody, and that was enough to understand each other's hearts.

voiceItems.title: About Aglaea
voiceItems.text: Remarkable... Such a delicate golden thread, yet when stained with blood, becomes so razor-sharp. The holy city's fragile, teetering future needs exactly this kind of youth.

voiceItems.title: About Tribbie, Trianne, and Trinnon
voiceItems.text: In chaotic times, many dismissed their prophecies, fooled by their childish looks... But wisdom knows no size, a truth that holds across all the seas.

voiceItems.title: About Cipher
voiceItems.text: My treasury has never needed guards, and her guarded heart has never loosened with age. It matters not. Let us quietly watch, and see what great thunderous waves this small kitten will raise in the future.

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: Fly the banners, and set off with me!

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: The sovereign shall walk ahead, and their people shall follow them.

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: This is not the end, merely the cornerstone of a grand endeavor.

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: Where I go, my name shall be sung in hymns.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Are you ready to charge into battle, Deliverer?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Aglaea
voiceItems.text: May your battle raiment bring us glory, Dux Goldweaver.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Tribbie
voiceItems.text: What end has the prophecy revealed for this war, Dux Fatorum?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Hysilens
voiceItems.text: Let lament be the herald of our triumphant songs, Dux Gladiorum.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Cipher
voiceItems.text: One piece of intelligence for one hundred Balance Coins. How does that sound, Dux Celeripes?

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: Ready yourself. Ruin is inevitable.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: Without risk... how does one expect to win?

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: If the world was all black or white, it would lose its charm.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: The weight of victory now rests in my hand.

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Don't try to stall your enemies... Tedious.

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Forward.

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text: Come now, step onto the board!

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text: Press the attack.

voiceItems.title: Skill 3
voiceItems.text: A bloody fight to the end.

voiceItems.title: Skill 4
voiceItems.text: Fight for me!

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: Flailing beast.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: You've got nerve.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: To the defeated, oblivion. To the victor, the throne...

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: In the name of Law, I declare: Your downfall is absolute!

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: For... the cause...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: Surrender a pawn to beg for peace? Never.

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: In the coming days, I shall grant you honor.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: A direct offensive... or crush them from the flanks?

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: I came. I saw. I conquered.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: Take stock of your deeds... and claim rewards as you see fit.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: To rise from nothing is also the way of a king.

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: Rejoice, but never stray from the greater cause.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: A game fit for children, yet you call upon me?

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: These mere parlor tricks cannot delight me.

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: The first-move advantage must not be wasted.

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: Be at ease. This place, too, shall know my protection.

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
The Northern Empire, a lost dynasty, where its frozen lands burn with the fever of conquest.
Sovereign Cerydra, the Chrysos Heir who wields the Coreflame of "Law," weaves her schemes, contends with the gods, passes judgment upon the faithless, and lays the foundation of Flame-Chase into this world.
..."This is far from the end. Amphoreus's journey is set to blaze across the stars!"

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
Hyperborea, the Northern Empire. A frigid realm where ambition burns without end.
Since the childless sovereign fell, the throne sits vacant while the empire tears itself apart in endless civil strife.

Refugees who lost their homes resort to begging to survive. A wounded girl with unusual blue hair stands out starkly against the pristine snow.
"Only the royal family blessed by Talanton possesses such flame-like blue hair, and only the chosen ones have golden blood flowing through their veins..."
An ambitious aristocrat takes in the beggar girl simply from just a passing glance, and begins spreading rumors of a lost princess.

They lead her onto a magnificent high stage where the aristocrat raises her arm high. From her pricked fingertip drips blood as golden as dawn itself.
The crowd below grows wild with excitement, and that heated anticipation seemingly sets her ablaze as well.

"From this day forward, you are Princess 'Cerydra'."
The aristocrat leads her into the palace, where she's dressed in ornate, heavy garments.
"Cery...dra?"
A single moment of hesitation earns her a slap so sharp it nearly brings tears to her eyes.
"I am... I am... Cery...dra..."
"I am Cerydra."
"I am her."
She controls her trembling as distant screams fade away.
— Those were the screams of the previous princess.

She studies royal etiquette daily until the tight corset no longer causes pain, until she can confidently deliver speeches...
"As the princess is still young, I shall serve as regent and oversee the Hyperborean Empire's affairs." The aristocrat gathers support in her name while seizing royal authority.
"She's merely a pawn we can discard, but she plays her role well enough to keep around." In the shadows, the new regent exchanges knowing smirks with the chancellor.

Endless days in captivity blur together as the young "princess" reluctantly abandons the distant shimmer of stars to focus on her chessboard.
This is the game for her self-preservation.

"Proud princess. Those eyes of yours, always watching, always hiding... They are like..."
"Like what?"
With barely any effort, she will soon reach the border of the chessboard.
"Like a flame soon to ignite..."

With a bittersweet smile, her teacher places down the final chess piece. After thousands of matches, there's no longer a chess strategy the princess has not mastered.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
The imperial maids and guards have no power or status, yet they become the ever-present eyes throughout the shifting court.
She wins them with favors, gathers intelligence, and weaves a complex web of strategies.
Old aristocrats who despise the new king secretly plot rebellion, placing assassins among the royal guards.
She plays the willing conspirator while secretly positioning her "knights" who will do the dirty work.
The empire's citizens revere her fabricated bloodline, so she extends charity to the elderly and supports the vulnerable.
Her rising reputation wins them over, making them into "rooks" who will dominate the board.

"Meet me in my tent at the third quint of Curtain-Fall Hour. Urgent matters to discuss in private, Your loyal chancellor."
As the sealed note finds its way to her, she knows her essential "bishop" has entered play, with each courtier now conspiring in pursuit of their covert desire for military expansion.

Candlelight dances across the tent, casting shadows of deceit. The chancellor wears a smile as hollow as a faded portrait.
"The northern territories share nothing with the south's gentle warmth." He points to the map sprawled before them, "Lingering here will be Hyperborea's undoing. I've secured the continent's most formidable mercenaries. The regent requests that you personally lead the campaign..."

She knows they see her as expendable, ready to blame her for any failure that might occur.
But she's waited far too long. Without a daring gamble, how could she ever hope to turn the tables?

Crossing the mountains of Epos, she seizes the opportunity when Loukas rises in rebellion. She crushes their forces while recruiting the Chrysos General Fortunado to her side, winning the army's loyalty.
City after city falls as Hyperborean armies advance like an unstoppable blaze. The blue-haired girl raises her banner, sending thundering hooves toward her chosen targets.
She watches her army build up, knowing her final "pawns" are positioned for checkmate.

On that dark, snowy night, the triumphant princess rides a silver-white steed, leading her forces through the capital gates to proclaim new edicts...
"From this day forward, I shall bring justice to Hyperborea!"

They drag the regent "king" who wears the false crown from his chambers, while his loyalists who refuse to bend find only soldiers' steel awaiting them.
"She... she is not Cerydra!"
From her throne of judgment, she draws her blade across her palm and golden blood trickles down as the crowd mocks him, drowning the "king" in despair.
"This regent 'king' has governed with depravity, plunging the empire into chaos. By the authority of the Law, I hereby sentence you..."

In the bitter northern winds, her blue hair dances wildly, blazing like fire against the pale sky.
"Death by fire!"

Amid the flames, she places the imperial crown upon her head, her only trophy of war.
A flicker of cobalt fire awakens atop the crown, never to be quenched again.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
The tripartite prophecy spreads from Janusopolis to the city-states in endless strife throughout the land.
"Saving the world... has never been of a chessmaster's interest."
She ponders the prophecy, envisioning a fiery future unfolding before her.
"But to challenge gods who see themselves as rulers, and even venture beyond the sky... now that's a game worth playing!"

Through the endless night, she draws golden-blooded children of humanity like a brilliant flame:
In Okhema's Council, Chrysos Heirs and common folk alike share the right to debate and vote.
Magnificent libraries rise from the ground, granting all access to knowledge of the Flame-Chase mission.
As ancient military orders crumble into dust, a gladius of the deep is drawn to shore, following the perfume of blood and fire to serve as her blades.
In the political waters of the holy city, the Goldweaver of Okhema rises on the horizon, and the trembles of golden threads entangle the people's fates.
...

Yet her chessboard is etched in golden blood, and she plays against gods themselves. Though she trades burning pain for her crown and suffers eternal infancy for the future, the scales of victory have never truly tipped in humanity's favor.
"Losses are a constant on the Flame-Chase journey..."
"Only through a worthy sacrifice can we gain a befitting victory. But to topple gods, this is far from enough..."
Day and night she studies the board, concealing her anxieties from any watchful eyes.

"If you're the chess master, then that makes us the pawns, right?"
Without waiting for an answer, the girl who wields a sword like a musical instrument wipes blood from her hands and nods.
"I understand now."
Only in moments like these would the proud empress fall uncharacteristically silent.
"If only..."
A trace of bitterness flickers across her face.
"No, there are no 'if onlys' anymore."

Before the battle to claim the Ocean's Coreflame, she stands once more upon the platform, looking down at five hundred subjects who hold their breath, awaiting her decree.

"My warriors..."
As her voice resounds, cheers erupt throughout the crowd.
"Today, the 'Ocean' shall surrender to us, and the beast of 'Destruction' will become our unstoppable weapon. Now, raise your cups! To our conquest of the sea of stars!"

She knows that only a crimson sea of no return awaits ahead, but she must wear the mask of the unflinching ruler.
In that moment, the wisdom of her teacher whispers to her again...

"Chess is the art of sacrifice."
"Your hands must accept death before touching the board."

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"Drip."
A drop of blood falls into water, sending golden ripples across the surface.

"Dux Gladiorum, have you thought about where our paths might lead after this battle ends?"
The sword-wielding girl stands in thoughtful silence before shaking her head.
"After the rebellion settles, we'll head for the stars. You'll find your crystal-clear ocean out there, I promise."
With a faint smile, she lifts her scepter skyward.
"The gods have pitted us against each other, letting Amphoreus end its own life in the cosmos. So I'll turn my blade on them, on every god, whether in our world or beyond."

"Drip."
A drop of blood falls into water, sending golden ripples across the surface.

"Dux Gladiorum, what if someday I command you to turn your blade against me?"
The girl remains silent, assuming it's just another of her cruel jokes.
"I'd want your sharpest edge. Anything less would dishonor those who sacrificed themselves for my cause."
She tosses the chess piece that represented herself off the board.
"See? To lose is to gain. New paths have emerged."

"Drip."
A drop of blood falls into water, sending golden ripples across the surface.

"Dux Gladiorum, who do you think can take up the heavy burden of the Flame-Chase journey once we're gone?"
In perfect unison, their gaze falls upon the distant "Goldweaver."
"That little golden trout will one day become the most magnificent fish in this pond."

"Drip."
A drop of blood falls into water, sending golden ripples across the surface.

"Many speculate about what I traded with Talanton. Was it the power of endless victory, or the authority of law... Heh. I've never needed any divine help for those..."

The silhouette of her past companion faded away. She felt the cold creeping in, the sky pitch black like a starless cave.
Long ago, she had also witnessed, in bone-chilling cold, a child with golden blood being taken away.

"But in this world that devours people, having golden blood... is the only chance to overthrow everything. Even if... I must live like this for the rest of my life..."

The blue-haired girl closes her eyes.
"But I've only wished for one thing... since the beginning..."
From a beggar child nearly frozen to death in the wilds, to a princess who was no better than a puppet, then to a commander who challenged gods... She personally elevated herself from pawn to player, only to sacrifice herself when the endgame demanded it...

"I wish to conquer the tyrannical fate of this world!"

name: Cerydra
descHash: The Northern Empire, a lost dynasty, where its frozen lands burn with the fever of conquest. Sovereign Cerydra, the Chrysos Heir who wields the Coreflame of "Law," weaves her schemes, contends with the gods, passes judgment upon the faithless, and lays the foundation of Flame-Chase into this world. ..."This is far from the end. Amphoreus's journey is set to blaze across the stars!"
